speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: SCENE I. Venice. A court of justice.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Enter the DUKE, the Magnificoes, ANTONIO, BASSANIO, GRATIANO, SALERIO, and others

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: What, is Antonio here?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Ready, so please your grace.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: I am sorry for thee: thou art come to answer

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: A stony adversary, an inhuman wretch

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: uncapable of pity, void and empty

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: From any dram of mercy.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I have heard

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Your grace hath ta'en great pains to qualify

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: His rigorous course; but since he stands obdurate

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And that no lawful means can carry me

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Out of his envy's reach, I do oppose

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: My patience to his fury, and am arm'd

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To suffer, with a quietness of spirit,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The very tyranny and rage of his.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Go one, and call the Jew into the court.

speaker: SALERIO
text_entry: He is ready at the door: he comes, my lord.

speaker: SALERIO
text_entry: Enter SHYLOCK

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Make room, and let him stand before our face.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Shylock, the world thinks, and I think so too,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: That thou but lead'st this fashion of thy malice

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: To the last hour of act; and then 'tis thought

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Thou'lt show thy mercy and remorse more strange

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Than is thy strange apparent cruelty;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And where thou now exact'st the penalty,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Which is a pound of this poor merchant's flesh,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Thou wilt not only loose the forfeiture,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: But, touch'd with human gentleness and love,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Forgive a moiety of the principal;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Glancing an eye of pity on his losses,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: That have of late so huddled on his back,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Enow to press a royal merchant down

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And pluck commiseration of his state

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: From brassy bosoms and rough hearts of flint,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: From stubborn Turks and Tartars, never train'd

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: To offices of tender courtesy.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: We all expect a gentle answer, Jew.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I have possess'd your grace of what I purpose;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And by our holy Sabbath have I sworn

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To have the due and forfeit of my bond:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If you deny it, let the danger light

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Upon your charter and your city's freedom.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You'll ask me, why I rather choose to have

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: A weight of carrion flesh than to receive

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Three thousand ducats: I'll not answer that:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: But, say, it is my humour: is it answer'd?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: What if my house be troubled with a rat

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And I be pleased to give ten thousand ducats

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To have it baned? What, are you answer'd yet?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Some men there are love not a gaping pig;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Some, that are mad if they behold a cat;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And others, when the bagpipe sings i' the nose,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Cannot contain their urine: for affection,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Mistress of passion, sways it to the mood

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Of what it likes or loathes. Now, for your answer:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: As there is no firm reason to be render'd,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Why he cannot abide a gaping pig;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Why he, a harmless necessary cat;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Why he, a woollen bagpipe; but of force

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Must yield to such inevitable shame

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: As to offend, himself being offended;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: So can I give no reason, nor I will not,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: More than a lodged hate and a certain loathing

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I bear Antonio, that I follow thus

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: A losing suit against him. Are you answer'd?

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: This is no answer, thou unfeeling man,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: To excuse the current of thy cruelty.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I am not bound to please thee with my answers.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Do all men kill the things they do not love?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Hates any man the thing he would not kill?

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Every offence is not a hate at first.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: What, wouldst thou have a serpent sting thee twice?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I pray you, think you question with the Jew:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You may as well go stand upon the beach

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And bid the main flood bate his usual height;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You may as well use question with the wolf

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Why he hath made the ewe bleat for the lamb;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You may as well forbid the mountain pines

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To wag their high tops and to make no noise,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: When they are fretten with the gusts of heaven;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You may as well do anything most hard,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: As seek to soften that--than which what's harder?--

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: His Jewish heart: therefore, I do beseech you,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Make no more offers, use no farther means,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But with all brief and plain conveniency

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Let me have judgment and the Jew his will.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: For thy three thousand ducats here is six.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: What judgment shall I dread, doing

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Were in six parts and every part a ducat,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I would not draw them; I would have my bond.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: How shalt thou hope for mercy, rendering none?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: What judgment shall I dread, doing no wrong?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You have among you many a purchased slave,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Which, like your asses and your dogs and mules,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You use in abject and in slavish parts,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Because you bought them: shall I say to you,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Let them be free, marry them to your heirs?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Why sweat they under burthens? let their beds

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Be made as soft as yours and let their palates

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Be season'd with such viands? You will answer

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: 'The slaves are ours:' so do I answer you:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The pound of flesh, which I demand of him,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Is dearly bought; 'tis mine and I will have it.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: If you deny me, fie upon your law!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: There is no force in the decrees of Venice.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I stand for judgment: answer; shall I have it?

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Upon my power I may dismiss this court,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Unless Bellario, a learned doctor,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Whom I have sent for to determine this,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Come here to-day.

speaker: SALERIO
text_entry: My lord, here stays without

speaker: SALERIO
text_entry: A messenger with letters from the doctor,

speaker: SALERIO
text_entry: New come from Padua.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Bring us the letter; call the messenger.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Good cheer, Antonio! What, man, courage yet!

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: The Jew shall have my flesh, blood, bones and all,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Ere thou shalt lose for me one drop of blood.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I am a tainted wether of the flock,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Meetest for death: the weakest kind of fruit

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Drops earliest to the ground; and so let me

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You cannot better be employ'd, Bassanio,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Than to live still and write mine epitaph.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Enter NERISSA, dressed like a lawyer's clerk

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Came you from Padua, from Bellario?

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: From both, my lord. Bellario greets your grace.

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: Presenting a letter

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Why dost thou whet thy knife so earnestly?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To cut the forfeiture from that bankrupt there.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Not on thy sole, but on thy soul, harsh Jew,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Thou makest thy knife keen; but no metal can,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: No, not the hangman's axe, bear half the keenness

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Of thy sharp envy. Can no prayers pierce thee?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: No, none that thou hast wit enough to make.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: O, be thou damn'd, inexecrable dog!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: And for thy life let justice be accused.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Thou almost makest me waver in my faith

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: To hold opinion with Pythagoras,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: That souls of animals infuse themselves

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Into the trunks of men: thy currish spirit

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Govern'd a wolf, who, hang'd for human slaughter,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Even from the gallows did his fell soul fleet,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: And, whilst thou lay'st in thy unhallow'd dam,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Infused itself in thee; for thy desires

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Are wolvish, bloody, starved and ravenous.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Till thou canst rail the seal from off my bond,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Thou but offend'st thy lungs to speak so loud:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Repair thy wit, good youth, or it will fall

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To cureless ruin. I stand here for law.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: This letter from Bellario doth commend

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: A young and learned doctor to our court.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Where is he?

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: He attendeth here hard by,

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: To know your answer, whether you'll admit him.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: With all my heart. Some three or four of you

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Go give him courteous conduct to this place.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Meantime the court shall hear Bellario's letter.

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: Your grace shall understand that at the receipt of

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: your letter I am very sick: but in the instant that

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: your messenger came, in loving visitation was with

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: me a young doctor of Rome; his name is Balthasar. I

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: acquainted him with the cause in controversy between

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: the Jew and Antonio the merchant: we turned o'er

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: many books together: he is furnished with my

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: opinion; which, bettered with his own learning, the

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: greatness whereof I cannot enough commend, comes

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: with him, at my importunity, to fill up your grace's

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: request in my stead. I beseech you, let his lack of

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: years be no impediment to let him lack a reverend

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: estimation; for I never knew so young a body with so

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: old a head. I leave him to your gracious

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: acceptance, whose trial shall better publish his

speaker: Clerk
text_entry: commendation.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: You hear the learn'd Bellario, what he writes:

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And here, I take it, is the doctor come.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Enter PORTIA, dressed like a doctor of laws

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Give me your hand. Come you from old Bellario?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I did, my lord.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: You are welcome: take your place.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Are you acquainted with the difference

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: That holds this present question in the court?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I am informed thoroughly of the cause.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Which is the merchant here, and which the Jew?

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Antonio and old Shylock, both stand forth.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Is your name Shylock?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Shylock is my name.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Of a strange nature is the suit you follow;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Yet in such rule that the Venetian law

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Cannot impugn you as you do proceed.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You stand within his danger, do you not?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Ay, so he says.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Do you confess the bond?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I do.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Then must the Jew be merciful.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: On what compulsion must I? tell me that.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The quality of mercy is not strain'd,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It droppeth as the gentle rain from heaven

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Upon the place beneath: it is twice blest;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It blesseth him that gives and him that takes:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: 'Tis mightiest in the mightiest: it becomes

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The throned monarch better than his crown;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: His sceptre shows the force of temporal power,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The attribute to awe and majesty,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Wherein doth sit the dread and fear of kings;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: But mercy is above this sceptred sway;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It is enthroned in the hearts of kings,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It is an attribute to God himself;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And earthly power doth then show likest God's

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: When mercy seasons justice. Therefore, Jew,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Though justice be thy plea, consider this,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That, in the course of justice, none of us

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Should see salvation: we do pray for mercy;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And that same prayer doth teach us all to render

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The deeds of mercy. I have spoke thus much

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: To mitigate the justice of thy plea;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Which if thou follow, this strict court of Venice

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Must needs give sentence 'gainst the merchant there.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: My deeds upon my head! I crave the law,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The penalty and forfeit of my bond.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Is he not able to discharge the money?

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Yes, here I tender it for him in the court;

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Yea, twice the sum: if that will not suffice,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: I will be bound to pay it ten times o'er,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: On forfeit of my hands, my head, my heart:

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: If this will not suffice, it must appear

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: That malice bears down truth. And I beseech you,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Wrest once the law to your authority:

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: To do a great right, do a little wrong,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: And curb this cruel devil of his will.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It must not be; there is no power in Venice

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Can alter a decree established:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: 'Twill be recorded for a precedent,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And many an error by the same example

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Will rush into the state: it cannot be.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: A Daniel come to judgment! yea, a Daniel!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: O wise young judge, how I do honour thee!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I pray you, let me look upon the bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Here 'tis, most reverend doctor, here it is.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Shylock, there's thrice thy money offer'd thee.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: An oath, an oath, I have an oath in heaven:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Shall I lay perjury upon my soul?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: No, not for Venice.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Why, this bond is forfeit;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And lawfully by this the Jew may claim

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: A pound of flesh, to be by him cut off

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Nearest the merchant's heart. Be merciful:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Take thrice thy money; bid me tear the bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: When it is paid according to the tenor.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: It doth appear you are a worthy judge;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You know the law, your exposition

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Hath been most sound: I charge you by the law,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Whereof you are a well-deserving pillar,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Proceed to judgment: by my soul I swear

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: There is no power in the tongue of man

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To alter me: I stay here on my bond.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Most heartily I do beseech the court

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To give the judgment.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Why then, thus it is:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You must prepare your bosom for his knife.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: O noble judge! O excellent young man!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: For the intent and purpose of the law

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Hath full relation to the penalty,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Which here appeareth due upon the bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: 'Tis very true: O wise and upright judge!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: How much more elder art thou than thy looks!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Therefore lay bare your bosom.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Ay, his breast:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: So says the bond: doth it not, noble judge?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: 'Nearest his heart:' those are the very words.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It is so. Are there balance here to weigh

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The flesh?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I have them ready.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Have by some surgeon, Shylock, on your charge,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: To stop his wounds, lest he do bleed to death.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Is it so nominated in the bond?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It is not so express'd: but what of that?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: 'Twere good you do so much for charity.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I cannot find it; 'tis not in the bond.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You, merchant, have you any thing to say?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But little: I am arm'd and well prepared.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Give me your hand, Bassanio: fare you well!

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Grieve not that I am fallen to this for you;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: For herein Fortune shows herself more kind

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Than is her custom: it is still her use

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To let the wretched man outlive his wealth,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To view with hollow eye and wrinkled brow

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: An age of poverty; from which lingering penance

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Of such misery doth she cut me off.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Commend me to your honourable wife:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Tell her the process of Antonio's end;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Say how I loved you, speak me fair in death;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And, when the tale is told, bid her be judge

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Whether Bassanio had not once a love.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Repent but you that you shall lose your friend,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And he repents not that he pays your debt;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: For if the Jew do cut but deep enough,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I'll pay it presently with all my heart.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Antonio, I am married to a wife

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Which is as dear to me as life itself;

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: But life itself, my wife, and all the world,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Are not with me esteem'd above thy life:

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: I would lose all, ay, sacrifice them all

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Here to this devil, to deliver you.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Your wife would give you little thanks for that,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: If she were by, to hear you make the offer.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I have a wife, whom, I protest, I love:

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I would she were in heaven, so she could

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Entreat some power to change this currish Jew.

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: 'Tis well you offer it behind her back;

speaker: NERISSA
text_entry: The wish would make else an unquiet house.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: These be the Christian husbands. I have a daughter;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Would any of the stock of Barrabas

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Had been her husband rather than a Christian!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Aside

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: We trifle time: I pray thee, pursue sentence.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: A pound of that same merchant's flesh is thine:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The court awards it, and the law doth give it.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Most rightful judge!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And you must cut this flesh from off his breast:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The law allows it, and the court awards it.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Most learned judge! A sentence! Come, prepare!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Tarry a little; there is something else.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: This bond doth give thee here no jot of blood;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The words expressly are 'a pound of flesh:'

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Take then thy bond, take thou thy pound of flesh;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: But, in the cutting it, if thou dost shed

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: One drop of Christian blood, thy lands and goods

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Are, by the laws of Venice, confiscate

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Unto the state of Venice.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: O upright judge! Mark, Jew: O learned judge!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Is that the law?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Thyself shalt see the act:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: For, as thou urgest justice, be assured

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Thou shalt have justice, more than thou desirest.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: O learned judge! Mark, Jew: a learned judge!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I take this offer, then; pay the bond thrice

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And let the Christian go.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Here is the money.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Soft!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The Jew shall have all justice; soft! no haste:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: He shall have nothing but the penalty.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: O Jew! an upright judge, a learned judge!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Therefore prepare thee to cut off the flesh.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Shed thou no blood, nor cut thou less nor more

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: But just a pound of flesh: if thou cut'st more

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Or less than a just pound, be it but so much

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: As makes it light or heavy in the substance,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Or the division of the twentieth part

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Of one poor scruple, nay, if the scale do turn

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: But in the estimation of a hair,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Thou diest and all thy goods are confiscate.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: A second Daniel, a Daniel, Jew!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Now, infidel, I have you on the hip.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Why doth the Jew pause? take thy forfeiture.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Give me my principal, and let me go.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: I have it ready for thee; here it is.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: He hath refused it in the open court:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: He shall have merely justice and his bond.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: A Daniel, still say I, a second Daniel!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I thank thee, Jew, for teaching me that word.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Shall I not have barely my principal?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Thou shalt have nothing but the forfeiture,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: To be so taken at thy peril, Jew.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Why, then the devil give him good of it!

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll stay no longer question.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Tarry, Jew:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The law hath yet another hold on you.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: It is enacted in the laws of Venice,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: If it be proved against an alien

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That by direct or indirect attempts

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: He seek the life of any citizen,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The party 'gainst the which he doth contrive

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Shall seize one half his goods; the other half

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Comes to the privy coffer of the state;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And the offender's life lies in the mercy

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Of the duke only, 'gainst all other voice.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: In which predicament, I say, thou stand'st;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: For it appears, by manifest proceeding,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That indirectly and directly too

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Thou hast contrived against the very life

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Of the defendant; and thou hast incurr'd

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The danger formerly by me rehearsed.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Down therefore and beg mercy of the duke.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Beg that thou mayst have leave to hang thyself:

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: And yet, thy wealth being forfeit to the state,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Thou hast not left the value of a cord;

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Therefore thou must be hang'd at the state's charge.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: That thou shalt see the difference of our spirits,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: I pardon thee thy life before thou ask it:

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: For half thy wealth, it is Antonio's;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: The other half comes to the general state,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Which humbleness may drive unto a fine.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Ay, for the state, not for Antonio.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Nay, take my life and all; pardon not that:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: You take my house when you do take the prop

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: That doth sustain my house; you take my life

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: When you do take the means whereby I live.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: What mercy can you render him, Antonio?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: A halter gratis; nothing else, for God's sake.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: So please my lord the duke and all the court

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To quit the fine for one half of his goods,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I am content; so he will let me have

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The other half in use, to render it,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Upon his death, unto the gentleman

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: That lately stole his daughter:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Two things provided more, that, for this favour,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: He presently become a Christian;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The other, that he do record a gift,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Here in the court, of all he dies possess'd,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Unto his son Lorenzo and his daughter.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: He shall do this, or else I do recant

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: The pardon that I late pronounced here.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Art thou contented, Jew? what dost thou say?

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I am content.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Clerk, draw a deed of gift.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I pray you, give me leave to go from hence;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I am not well: send the deed after me,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: And I will sign it.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Get thee gone, but do it.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: In christening shalt thou have two god-fathers:

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Had I been judge, thou shouldst have had ten more,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: To bring thee to the gallows, not the font.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Exit SHYLOCK

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Sir, I entreat you home with me to dinner.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I humbly do desire your grace of pardon:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I must away this night toward Padua,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And it is meet I presently set forth.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: I am sorry that your leisure serves you not.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Antonio, gratify this gentleman,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: For, in my mind, you are much bound to him.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Exeunt Duke and his train

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Most worthy gentleman, I and my friend

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Have by your wisdom been this day acquitted

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Of grievous penalties; in lieu whereof,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Three thousand ducats, due unto the Jew,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: We freely cope your courteous pains withal.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And stand indebted, over and above,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: In love and service to you evermore.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: He is well paid that is well satisfied;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And I, delivering you, am satisfied

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And therein do account myself well paid:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: My mind was never yet more mercenary.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I pray you, know me when we meet again:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I wish you well, and so I take my leave.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Dear sir, of force I must attempt you further:

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Take some remembrance of us, as a tribute,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Not as a fee: grant me two things, I pray you,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Not to deny me, and to pardon me.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You press me far, and therefore I will yield.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: To ANTONIO

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Give me your gloves, I'll wear them for your sake;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: To BASSANIO

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And, for your love, I'll take this ring from you:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Do not draw back your hand; I'll take no more;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And you in love shall not deny me this.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: This ring, good sir, alas, it is a trifle!

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: I will not shame myself to give you this.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I will have nothing else but only this;

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And now methinks I have a mind to it.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: There's more depends on this than on the value.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: The dearest ring in Venice will I give you,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: And find it out by proclamation:

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Only for this, I pray you, pardon me.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: I see, sir, you are liberal in offers

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You taught me first to beg; and now methinks

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: You teach me how a beggar should be answer'd.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Good sir, this ring was given me by my wife;

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: And when she put it on, she made me vow

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: That I should neither sell nor give nor lose it.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: That 'scuse serves many men to save their gifts.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: An if your wife be not a mad-woman,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: And know how well I have deserved the ring,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: She would not hold out enemy for ever,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: For giving it to me. Well, peace be with you!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Exeunt Portia and Nerissa

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: My Lord Bassanio, let him have the ring:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Let his deservings and my love withal

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Be valued against your wife's commandment.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Go, Gratiano, run and overtake him;

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Give him the ring, and bring him, if thou canst,

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Unto Antonio's house: away! make haste.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Exit Gratiano

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Come, you and I will thither presently;

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: And in the morning early will we both

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Fly toward Belmont: come, Antonio.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Exeunt
